step1.sentence: She wanted to try out the new recipe before serving it at the dinner party.

step2.story: The company released a beta version of the app and asked a small group of users to try it out. The feedback they received helped fix three major issues before the public launch.

step3.story: Adam had been curious about rock climbing for years but never dared to start. His coworker finally convinced him to try out the indoor wall on a Saturday morning. He fell off the first route four times in a row. But by the end of the session, he had made it to the top of the beginner route and was already planning his next visit.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 어떤 것이 실제로 잘 작동하거나 맞는지 테스트하거나 경험해보다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 새 제품, 방법, 활동을 직접 시험해볼 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: try(시도하다)와 out(완전히, 실제로)이 결합하여 실제로 써보거나 경험해본다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 이론이 아닌 실제 경험을 통한 시험을 강조합니다. test와 비슷하지만 더 구어체적이고 능동적인 느낌입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: I got a new blender and can't wait to try it out this weekend.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 새 블렌더를 사서 이번 주말에 써보고 싶어요.
